meanings.definition: To come into being or notice; originate
meanings.sent1: Each morning, the sun will arise in the east.
meanings.sent2: The idea for the new project arose during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: It was quite a surprise to see a unicorn arise from the bushes!
meanings.sent4: Hope can arise from the darkest of situations.
meanings.sent5: The phoenix will arise from its ashes, reborn and renewed.

meanings.definition: To get up from sitting, lying, or kneeling
meanings.sent1: After the nap, she will arise from the couch.
meanings.sent2: The students will arise when the bell rings.
meanings.sent3: The cat will arise lazily from its nap on the warm windowsill.
meanings.sent4: Like a sleepy bear, he will arise from his winter slumber.
meanings.sent5: With a yawn, the dog will arise from its cozy bed.

meanings.sent1: The hot air balloon will slowly arise into the sky.
meanings.sent2: The plane will arise smoothly after takeoff.
meanings.sent3: The bubbles in the fizzy drink will arise to the surface.
meanings.sent4: Her spirits will arise as she climbs the mountain.
meanings.sent5: The elevator will arise to the top floor with a gentle hum.
